result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie James Archer in court.  Attorney John j Forrestal in court for Willie James Archer.  Prosecuting attorney John J Rejowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Defense counsel informs the Court that the defendant has pending matters in Br 46 that will be resolving with a global resolution and requests this case be transferred to Br 46. Court authorizes transfer to Br 46, Judge Feiss. Case set on Judge Feiss's calendar. Case adjourned to Br 46.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney John j Forrestal in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Defendant was given court date slip by deputy.  Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie James Archer in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review of additional discovery. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie James Archer in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie James Archer in court with Attorney John j Forrestal; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
